question:
The disparity in prevalence of vision impairment between low and high income countries was highlighted in the World Vision Report. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Myopia is more common in the high income countries of Asia than in its low income countries.
  2. South-east Asian region has the highest burden of visual impairment.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Myopia is an impairment that affects the ability to see at a distance. It is common in those under 19 years and is a refractive error. The high income countries of Asia have a bigger burden of myopia than the low income countries. Statement 2 is incorrect: The 3 Asian regions- south, east and south-east account for 62% of the people with visual impairment in the world. Of these three regions, the south Asian region has the highest burden with over 61 million affected people. The south-east Asia has 20.8 million affected people.
